intro: Valerianoides mutabilis, commonly known as the variable valerian, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple, depending on the environmental conditions. The plant typically grows in moist, shady areas and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly rough texture. Valerianoides mutabilis is known for its ability to change flower color, a trait that makes it an interesting subject for botanical study.
